Injection for spinal anaesthesia: 0.5% (hydrochloride) in 4-mL ampoule to be mixed with 7.5% glucose solution.

drugs.name: Lidocaine
drugs.description:
Injection: 1%; 2% (hydrochloride) in vial.

Injection for spinal anaesthesia: 5% (hydrochloride) in 2-mL ampoule to be mixed with 7.5% glucose solution. 

Topical forms: 2% to 4% (hydrochloride).

drugs.name: Lidocaine + epinephrine(adrenaline)
drugs.description:
Dental cartridge: 2% (hydrochloride) + epinephrine 1:80000.

Injection: 1%; 2% (hydrochloride or sulfate) + epinephrine 1: 200 000 in vial.

Solid oral dosage form: 250 mg; 500 mg (as trihydrate).

Powder for injection: 250 mg; 500 mg; 1 g (as sodium) in vial.

drugs.description:
Oral liquid: 125 mg amoxicillin + 31.25 mg clavulanic acid/5 mL AND 250 mg amoxicillin + 62.5 mg clavulanic acid/5 mL.

Tablet: 500 mg (as trihydrate) + 125 mg (as potassium salt).

Powder for injection: 500 mg (as sodium) + 100 mg (as potassium salt); 1000 mg (as sodium) + 200 mg (as potassium salt) in vial.

NB:1.44 g benzylpenicillin (= 2.4 million IU) in 5- mL vial.

drugs.name: Ceftriaxone

* Do not administer with calcium and avoid in infants with hyperbilirubinaemia

drugs.name: Cloxacillin
drugs.description:
Capsule: 500 mg; 1 g (as sodium salt). 

Powder for injection: 500 mg (as sodium salt) in vial.

 Powder for oral liquid: 125 mg (as sodium salt)/5 mL. 

*Cloxacillin, dicloxacillin and flucloxacillin are preferred for oral administration due to better bioavailability.

drugs.name: Phenoxymethylpenicillin
drugs.description:
Powder for oral liquid: 250 mg (as potassium salt)/5 mL.

Tablet: 250 mg (as potassium salt).

drugs.name: Piperacillin + Tazobactam
drugs.description: Powder for injection: 2 g (as sodium salt) + 250 mg (as sodium salt); 4 g (as sodium salt) + 500 mg (as sodium salt) in vial

drugs.name: Procaine benzylpenicillin*
drugs.description:
Powder for injection: 1 g (=1 million IU); 3 g (=3 million IU) in vial.

* Procaine benzylpenicillin is not recommended as first-line treatment for neonatal sepsis / sepsis except in settings with high neonatal mortality, when given by trained health workers in cases where hospital care is not achievable.

drugs.name: Ceftazidime
drugs.description: Powder for injection: 250 mg or 1 g (as pentahydrate) in vial.

drugs.name: Meropenem

owder for injection: 500 mg (as trihydrate); 1 g (as trihydrate) in vial in children >3 months.

 *imipenem + cilastatin is an alternative except for acute bacterial meningitis where meropenen is preferred.

njection for intravenous administration: 800 mg and 1 g in 10-mL phosphate buffer solution.

* For the treatment of viral haemorrhagic fevers only.

drugs.name: Oseltamivir

Oral powder: 12 mg/ mL.

* Severe illness due to confirmed or suspected influenza virus infection in critically ill hospitalized patients

drugs.description:
Powder for oral solution: 50 mg/mL

Tablet: 450 mg.

*For the treatment of cytomegalovirus retinitis (CMVr).

drugs.name: Diloxanide
drugs.description:
Tablet: 500 mg (furoate).

For children  >25 kg

drugs.name: Metronidazole
drugs.description:
Injection: 500 mg in 100-mL vial.

Oral liquid: 200 mg (as benzoate)/5 mL.

Tablet: 200 mg to 500 mg.

drugs.name: Amphotericin B
drugs.description:
Powder for injection: 50 mg in vial.

 As sodium deoxycholate or liposomal complex.

drugs.name: Miltefosine
drugs.description: Solid oral dosage form: 10 mg; 50 mg.

drugs.name: Paromomycin
drugs.description: Solution for intramuscular injection: 750 mg of paromomycin base (as the sulfate).

drugs.name: Sodium stibogluconate or meglumine antimoniate
drugs.description: Injection: 100 mg/mL, 1 vial = 30 mL or 30%, equivalent to approximately 8.1% antimony (pentavalent) in 5-mL ampoule.

drugs.name: Amodiaquine
drugs.description:
Tablet: 153 mg or 200 mg (as hydrochloride).

*To be used in combination with artesunate 50 mg.

drugs.name: Artemether
drugs.description:
Oily injection: 80 mg/mL in 1-mL ampoule.

* For use in the management of severe malaria.

drugs.name: Artemether + Lumefantrine
drugs.description:
Tablet: 20 mg + 120 mg.

Tablet(dispersible): 20 mg + 120 mg.

** Not recommended in the first trimester of pregnancy or in children below 5 kg.

drugs.name: Artesunate
drugs.description:
Injection: ampoules, containing 60 mg anhydrous artesunic acid with a separate ampoule of 5% sodium bicarbonate solution.

For use in the management of severe malaria.

Rectal dosage form: 50 mg; 100 mg; 200 mg capsules (for pre-referral treatment of severe malaria only; patients should be taken to an appropriate health facility for follow-up care).

Tablet: 50 mg.

* To be used in combination with either amodiaquine, mefloquine or sulfadoxine + pyrimethamine.

drugs.name: Artesunate + Amodiaquine

drugs.name: Acetylsalicylic acid* (acute or chronic use)
drugs.description:
Suppository: 50 mg to 150 mg.  Acetylsalicylic acid* (acute or chronic use)
Tablet: 100 mg to 500 mg.
*For use for rheumatic fever, juvenile arthritis, Kawasaki disease.
